description: I have experience working with Guidewire, particularly in developing PolicyCenter forms and designing Thunderhead document templates with data mapping.
I have experience in Selenium and have developed a testing automation tool in Java Selenium for policy processing from the UI.

projects.summary: Results-driven Software Developer with strong expertise in building scalable applications using Java, Spring Boot, and modern web technologies. Experienced in developing RESTful microservices, automating test workflows with Selenium, and designing end-to-end integration solutions using SnapLogic and Mulesoft. Proven ability to lead backend development for enterprise-grade systems such as Guidewire PolicyCenter, including form customization and document generation with Thunderhead. Adept at full software development lifecycle (SDLC), from requirement analysis to deployment and maintenance. Passionate about clean code, performance optimization, and cross-functional collaboration.

details: Started my professional journey as a Guidewire Developer, specializing in "PolicyCenter" for one year. During this time, I was responsible for designing insurance forms and templates using Guidewire technologies. I worked on various projects involving PCF, forms, data mapping, XML, and DiffTree projects.
Developed and maintained automation scripts for internal projects using Selenium over a span of six months, greatly enhancing the efficiency and reliability of business processes.

Currently serving as a Software Developer in the Internal Conversion Product Team, where I apply problem-solving skills and in-depth analysis to develop effective solutions for time-consuming challenges. I proficiently utilize “Java”, “Spring Boot”, and “MySQL” to create API solutions.
